inn1.comm: everything is underway, almost, Taylor starts one wide of off stump and it swings a lot wider, too wide for the umpire's liking
on a length and line this time, and still some good shape away from the bat, neatly defended by the super-stylish Amla into the off side, even in defence there's a flurry of wrists
good ball again, this time Amla leave it well alone
lovely shot this, it was in the slot full on off stump, Amla leant on a punch-drive through point for the first boundary, quite why Amla is not in the T20 side is beyond me
nicely played once more, Taylor striving for swing from a full length, Amla punches crisply through cover for a couple
better ball, just dragging the length back a fraction, and defended into the covers

Bravo almost pulls off something special! Top fielding, it was a good forcing shot into the cover region, Bravo dived and fielded in a flash as the single was taken, but the throw narrowly missed the stumps at the strikers end
good start from Rampaul, who is in the side in place of Roach, who has an ankle injury, full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
a touch shorter and a fraction wider, allowing Amla a comfortable leave
big grunt from Rampaul as he delivers this on to middle and leg, Amla defends very correctly to mid on
Amla loves any width outside off stump, and there was enough here for him to fiddle it down to third man for a gentle single
Smith finally faces his first ball, and does so in unspectacular style, grimacing at the ball and leaving it outside off
it's a relief to see Smith scowling again, I was a bit thrown by all his smiles in the T20, he watches this carefully and defends into the off side
Amla stands tall, right up on his toes, and punches past cover for a couple, very crisp timing
in a Test match this would have been a dodgy shot, touch of extra bounce means the back-foot forcing shot flies through a vacant gully region for another single
good ball, angling it across the left-hander, Smith fishes but luckily for him, it misses the edge
don't bowl there to Smith, he'll eat it up all day, on the legs, worked through midwicket for a boundary
this time it's a better ball, defended away into the off side for a swift single
good ball to finish, bang on off stump, not giving Amla the hint of room he needs to force it away, so it's defended very correctly back to the bowler
a touch fuller this time from Rampaul, Smith bunts forward and full-faces it back to the bowler
the pitch has behaved fairly well so far but this climbed a fraction, forcing Smith to hop back and defend from off stump
good cricket all round here, neatly clipped from off stump behind square on the leg side, a diving piece of fielding from Fletcher keeps it to one
Amla is all style, he never does anything more than punch the ball, and why would he, this is full and he leans forward and crisply drives through cover for another boundary
slightly shorter this time, preventing the shot so it's defended back to the bowler
nicely played here, slower ball and Amla waited on the back foot and guided it to third man
erm, not a very dependable start there! High full toss well outside off stump, surprised Amla as well and he could only guide it with an open face past point for a couple
follows the full toss with a no ball, angled down to third man for a single, but it's free hit time
the free hit is a big enough invitation for Smith to stand quite still and heave his enormous arms through the line of the ball, sending it over straight-midwicket for six
finally Sammy gets it right, landing on a length and line and Smith defends
back of a length, Smith stays back and works it round the corner for one
not great bowling this, woeful in fact, with the fine leg up, Sammy shoves it down the leg side, Amla flicks his wrists and sends it past the short-fine leg for another boundary
too much width outside off, Amla opens the face and guides it to third man for a strike-stealing single
edged! Wide of keeper and slip, though, second slip would've snaffled that up
two in two for Rampaul - almost! Amla did well not to get a touch on this ball as it fizzed up and away from him off a length. Great bowling there, hands on head time for Rampaul
good start after the break from Rampaul, just short of a length on off stump and Amla punches back to the bowler
nicely bowled again, no width, forced past cover for a single
good running here from Smith, it was pitched up, Smith dropped it into the off side and set off for a sharp single
lovely shot to finish! Amla clearly not bothered by the interruption, leans on the front foot and drives crisply for yet another off-side boundary
tight line to start, zoning in on off stump and Smith gets forward to punch defensively to point
fuller this time, and Smith was again straight onto the front foot to thump the ball - but straight to mid off

well, that's poor bowling really. Fine leg was up and he'd come round the wicket, but he dished up a length delivery slipping down leg and all Smith had to do was get something on it to send it to the boundary
full, wide and slapped to point, where Pollard leaps to his left to cut the ball off. Cries of "catch it!" from Bravo, but the ball got to him on the half volley. Good stop though

that's the line! Bravo pulls his length back a touch and keeps the ball in the channel outside off stump. Smith's feet went nowhere as he tried to force through the covers, and Ramdin is the grateful recipient of the resulting thick edge. One down!
Kallis is unflustered first ball, leaning his bulky frame forward in solid defence
wide of off and on a length, Amla slaps to cover
more width this time, Amla carves out through the off side but there's a fielder out to keep it to one
watchful stuff from Kallis first up as Rampaul lands it on a length and he shoulders arms to a rising delivery
Kallis was a little surprised by the bounce on this one as he tried to glide down to third man, but recovered well to ride it and pick up one
much fuller, Amla comes forward to drive languidly to mid off. The shot oozed class, but was straight to the fielder
uppercut from Amla! Slashing cut outside off and he sent the ball up and over. It looked a certain boundary but the third man fielder did really well to cut it off
punched into the covers, no run
Kallis walks down the wicket and gets across to the offside, looking to open up the leg side but drives a full ball straight to mid on
and again, the ball was slanting towards leg this time so he didn't have to manufacture the shot, but sent the ball to exactly the same man

double strike from Bravo! The ball wasn't great - a short, wide long hop. But Kallis really reached for it as he tried to slash over the off side. A big top edge flew down to third man, where the fielder held on to an easy chance. Another one goes down!
solid forward defence from Amla after the wicket
dropped behind square, they sprint through and Amla keeps strike
full, slanting in with the angle as it's delivered from wide of the crease, driven to long on
another sumptuous-looking drive from Amla, into the off side this time, but he can't find the gap
Rampaul has kept his length full so far this over, and again he's driven but without great timing this time, and straight to mid on
back of a length with just a hint of width on offer too. Amla gets back and aims to guide to third man, but finds gully. Good bowling so far

ah, he's given it all away with that ball! All the pressure comes off as Rampaul digs one in half way down, but it's ill-directed and heading down the leg side. Amla is excellent on the pull and he doesn't miss out, thrashing the ball out to deep square leg
better line and length, Amla hops back to defend
de Villiers is off the mark with a drop 'n run to midwicket. Sharp running
full, clipped straight back to the bowler
driven out to the cover sweeper with much class, just the one run though
wobbling in through the air and landing on a length, de Villiers is solidly forward and right behind the ball to block
straying outside off stump and de Villiers frees his arms with a full swing of the bat, but the ball flies straight to extra cover
just nipping away off the seam this time, de Villiers keeps a sharp eye on the ball and raises his bat out of the way to leave well alone
dug in outside off, Amla gets right across to the off side after starting on a leg-stump guard and gets up on tip-toe to get on top of the bounce and run it down to third man
fuller this time, and straight - de Villiers defends
he thought about leaving this one alone for a second, but hung is bat out looking for the run to short third man. Can't place it though, and gully swoops in
chopped to point, Pollard is quickly into position to field and hurl in a return
de Villiers shimmies across to off to change the line, and clips out on the leg side to pick up one
ooh, that would've had a third slip interested! Amla went back to drive a shortish ball through the covers but it just rose on him a touch and flew off a thick edge down to third man.

huge appeal from Bravo. But Amla had come way across his stumps - you could almost see all three behind him - and was hit way outside the line. No way that ball was hitting the stumps, and rightfully turned down by the umpire
looking to force through the off side, the ball takes the inside edge, ricocheting off the pad, but not into space

uppish! Pitched up by Bravo - it looked a little slower through the air and may have been the cutter. It certainly gripped in the pitch a little as Amla came forward to drive. Luckily he tried to hit it hard, and so it flew up and over the cover fielder!
play-and-a-miss from de Villiers! Bravo is bowling with great guile here, mixing up his speeds and lengths and getting the ball to move both ways at will. The batsman is well beaten on the drive
solid defence to the off side
and again, he was looking for the runs behind square on the off side but chopped it down defensively in the end. Great over from Bravo
Amla is right across his stumps as Taylor fires one in full and fast. Clipped to midwicket, but finds the fielder
short and pulled well, but square leg dives to his right to cut it off and negate the run
dropped on the leg side again, the fielder is in in a flash and they decide against the run
Amla is looking to push almost everything from Taylor to the on side. He succeeds in placing a clip off the hips this time and collects two
goo-looking drive, but West Indies have been pretty sharp in the field so far and mid on tumbles down to cut off the on drive
wristy flick to leg, again mid-on is in business to cut off the run
bad line from Bravo, straying down leg and de Villiers flicks with ease down to fine leg for four. There's a fielder out but that was well-placed, really fine
de Villiers gets forward to drive but closes the bat face too early in the shot, the bottom hand comes through and he sends the ball to mid on instead of into the covers
on a length outside off, he opens the face to pick up a run to third man

that might be the first bad shot Amla has played today. He's just three short of his fifty but that really wasn't good execution, he just stood at the crease and hung his bat out without conviction, the ball beats the outside edge
much better this time, the feet are moving again and he gets forward and across to push the ball to mid on, who is deep so they sprint through for one
Bravo loses his line once again, pushing the ball down leg. Luckily for him de Villiers couldn't get bat on this. Still a wide though
straightish again, pushed to midwicket, no run
good stuff from Taylor, full and straight, Amla flicks it away for a single to square leg

oh dear, poor cricket from Taylor, squanders a good run out chance, de Villiers worked it to third man and sprinted off in search of a couple, Talylor was absent minded and lolling about in the middle of the pitch, if he was behind the stumps to collect the throw from the bowlers end it could have been out
really sloppy this from Taylor, shoved down the leg side harmlessly, de Villers has to help himself to a boundary to fine leg
better this time, on a length and line and defended
Taylor finally locates a proper line and length, and de Villiers is content to block
ooh, close again, de Villiers pushed it to Pollard at cover, Amla had come a long way down in search of a single, de Villiers sends him back but the throw misses the stumps
that's fifty for Amla, hasn't he played well. First innings in the West Indies and he's been fluent and stylish, this time working it to third man for the single
De Villiers waits on the back foot and carefully guides this behind square for one
Amla back and defending with a pendulum-straight bat, back to the bowler
dug in much shorter, it's not that quick a bouncer but it gets up high, Amla makes a late effort to dink/upper-cut over the keeper but misses
touch fuller here, and worked round the corner for a single
full and wide of off stump, oddly, de Villiers treats it with utmost respect and shoulders arms
much shorter this time, Amla waits and plays a delicate pull down to the square leg boundary for a single
too far down the leg side again, allows de Villiers to turn it to fine leg casually
nicely played again, but Taylor, who is working his way back from injury it must be remembered, has not got his line right, angling towards the legs and Amla happily works it wide of midwicket
nicely played, it was a quicker ball from Taylor, tight on off stump and Amla opened the face and guided it fine towards third man for another couple
much better from Taylor, tight line on off stump, not giving Amla room to punch a drive
almost good again from Taylor, but a fraction wide, allows Amla to stand tall and force it past point for a single
he starts well enough, finding some spin and catching the edge outside off stump, trickles down to third man for a couple
this time it's flighted a touch more, Amla works it down the ground for a single
nicely bowled again, touch of flight and turn, gets the edge, it skims down to third man
but this is a touch too full, de Villiers skips down the wicket and gently drives into the covers for a single
nicely bowled, hanging in the air and Amla stretches forward and defends
Amla leans forward and taps this into the off side for a single
poor start from Sammy, at his pace there is no good reason to lose line like this, shoved down the leg side and tickled away for four
Amla corrects his line, outside off, Amla defends, picking a gap at cover for a single
nicely bowled here, on a length and line finally and de Villiers defends
pretty sedate stuff here, just a good ball and  de Villiers pushes it down the ground for a single
nicely played, very delicate, full and Amla opened the face of the bat in the final moment, angling it fine to third man
simple stuff for Amla works this towards point to get a single and keep the strike
starts well enough, angling it in on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket for a single
nicely bowled again, flatter as de Villiers started running down the wicket at him, guided away for a single
Amla angles his bat and sends the ball into a gap for one
nicely played by Gayle, chipping down the wicket and clipping into the leg side for one
Amla serene as ever, picking his gap on the leg side and flicking his wrists at the ball to find it
oh close this time! De Villiers edged down the track and chipped it just wide of the short midwicket fielder
Miller back and continuing his good work, de Villiers trying to force him away but can't get any power on it
good again from the bowler, de Villiers trying to edge down the wicket but he's beaten in the flight
slightly shorter this time and de Villiers is forced to defend
get-out shot here, the batsman down on one knee and dabbing a sweep shot away
Amla has no fuss at the moment, casually working this away for one
dabbed away behind square for a single
Gayle slings one in quickly, and nothing the batsman can do but defend
this time de Villiers picks up the single working it behind square
Amla once again flicks his wrists and helps the ball on the angle down the leg side for another single
well played, deflecting on the pads, de Villiers works it to fine leg for a comfortable three, Miller runs in and pulls it back inside the ropes
slightly slower here from Gayle, Amla tries to work it down the ground but can't beat the bowler
turning into the pads, Amla tucks it to midwicket, to keep the strike
floated up, De Villiers stretches forward and pushes gently into a gap at cover
back of a length this time, forced off the back foot, piercing the field in the off side
worked down to long on for another single
slower, and a touch of spin, Amla pushes it gently back to the bowler
down the track, looking for something big, but it's well bowled and Amla can't beat the bowler
fired in at middle and leg, de Villiers defends
much quicker here, really flung in, De Villiers jumps back and pushes to long on
slower and more loopy here, worked to deep cover for one
pitches and spins into the pads, helped away in front of square for one
flatter outside off, Amla pushes it square for a single
flighted up and flicked to midwicket
nicely bowled, touch of air, but Amla deflects it behind square for a single
fullish and milked easily through midwicket for a couple
picks a gap at cover with a careful drive
tickled to fine leg, very deft, collects a couple easily
good ball, touch of turn outside off, beats a flashing blade of Amla
Beaten again! Outside off, touch of turn, Amla flashes at thin air
shortish from Gayle, de Villiers gets back and has plenty of time to work it to long on
slightly fuller, Amla drives it to long on for another single
this is very simple stuff for South Africa, de Villiers works it from outside off to midwicket for another milked single
slightly quicker this time, Amla goes back to try and work it into the leg side but misses
much fuller and quicker outside off, Amla tries to angle it to third man but misses
this time he connects on a gentle leg-side work for one

goodness me this was bad fielding, flighted up, Amla drives through to the wide mid off boundary, but the sweeper on the off side seemed to be running with his brakes on - Taylor it was, must still not be fully fit
beaten! Good follow-up, bouncing and spinning past the outside edge
down on one knee and angling it down to fine leg for one
de Villiers gets back and across and defends this back to the bowler
flatter ball, de Villiers back and pulling down to the midwicket fielder for a single
worked round the corner, using the angle, for a gentle single
comes down the track and works it to backward square leg
nicely played be de Villiers, chipping down the crease and driving down to Bravo at long on who misfields and allows a couple
worked into the leg side for a swift single
Gayle round the wicket now, Amla waits carefully and drops it on the off side and scampers one
de Villiers calmly doing this, edging down the track and driving to long on
tickled round the corner for an easy single
over the wicket to Amla, not sure why, angled into Amla's pads, he duly works it behind square for a couple
similar line and it's worked away behind square again
not sure this is a good line of attack, it makes the leg-side deflection to easy, de Villiers obliges
this time Miller is back around the wicket, gives Amla too much room outside off and it's cut to point
worked away to square leg this time for a strike-stealing single
starts very gently outside off, de Villiers waits and guides it to third man, and it's another single
well bowled this time, more intent, fuller and on off stump, Amla defends back to the bowler
Pollard drags his length back a fraction, allowing Amla to open the face and take a single to third man
back of a length again, de Villiers pushes it down to long off
very deftly turned to short fine leg, in a flash de Villiers had called through a single
full and milked casually through the covers for a single
floated into a leg-stump line, tickled for a single to bring up 50 for de Villiers, well played him
very nice here, full and spinning past the Amla's attempted drive
this time it's more securely worked into the leg side for a single
oh dear, arrowed down the leg side, Ramdin misses it and it skips towards the fine leg boundary, where a diving stop saves the boundary
very full, Amla pushes it straight to point and runs a single
fuller and flighted and worked back to the bowler
oh good shot, de Villiers edged down the wicket and was actually beaten in the flight, so adjusted his shot and ended up lifting it firmly over deep midwicket for six
Brilliant innings! Amla collects his hundred, dabbing this down to third man, it has been such a composed knock
dug in short from Pollard as he saw de Villiers giving him the charge, it bounces over an attempted pull
de Villiers looking to up the rate here, edging down the track and leg side of the ball and swiping straight to cover
slightly too far down the leg side from Pollard, Amla tickles finely for one
shortish and enough room for de Villiers to guide it to third man for a single
hint of width outside off, Amla helps it easily down to third man

gone! Stumps splattered! That has come out of nowhere! Rampaul lands his first ball on a decent line and length, Amla plays back to one he should have come forward to, and it clatters into the stumps. West Indies really needed that
deals with his first ball well enough, plenty of time to get on the back foot and defend
fuller this time, Duminy still hanging on the back foot, plays it into the midwicket region easily enough
angled across the left-hander, very exaggerated leave
back of a length once more and pushed to mid off
hint of extra bounce from Rampaul, surprises Duminy, who defends. All of which means it's a wicket-maiden over
Pollard gets this wrong, slipping it too far down leg and it's a wide
back of a length, on a decent line, defended down to long on for a single
harsh call I reckon, it was a bouncer that passed Duminy's helmet over the top of middle stump, and wide called
this time it's defended carefully off the back foot to point
nicely played, gets inside the line and works it to fine leg for one
what a lovely shot that is, all timing from de Villiers. It was a touch short and wide from Pollard, de Villiers gently and carefully cut through point for four
fuller this time, de Villiers pushes it into the covers for one
good length and line to finish, Duminy defends off the back foot
good stuff from Rampaul extracting some extra bounce, de Villiers rides it and opens the face, sending it down to third man
fuller from Rampaul, pushed down to long on
very deliberate plan to attack Duminy with the short ball and Rampaul lands this very well, Duminy tries to hook but gets in a real tangle
pitch it up and Duminy is much more comfortable, stretching forward and pushing down the ground for one
good pace from Rampaul, beats de Villiers outside off stump
really running in hard, impressive stuff from Rampaul, finds extra bounce outside off, de Villiers stands up on his toes, drops it into the off side and collects one
horror ball to start with, and got everything it deserved, short and de Villiers pulls it to midwicket for a boundary
this time it's fuller and driven firmly down the ground for a couple more
better ball this time, slightly quicker and pushed to mid on
well, how about this, de Villiers skips down the wicket and swipes it over square leg for six
all delicacy this time, carefully opening the face and sending it to short third man for one
Duminy not looking fluent yet, comes down the wicket and defends back to the bowler
good start to a new spell for Bravo, slower ball, De Villiers guides it round the corner for a single
angled towards Duminy's pads, he misses the attempted nurdle and it thuds away for a single
played with the fullest of faces down to long off for a single
Duminy gets a short ball from Bravo, and it zips up over his crouch
fuller ball and worked to long on, the batsmen think about two but the throw comes in too quickly
touch looser to finish the over, flashed down to point off the front foot, deep cover races round to keep it to two
decent enough start to Taylor's new spell, on off stump and dabbed down to third man, easily enough, I wonder how long it will take for South Africa to really let fly
nicely played, it was short and on off stump. De Villiers played a tennis-like swat down to extra cover for a couple
this time it's a good ball that is  defended back to the bowler
fuller, touch of swing into the right-hander, flayed past point for a single
Duminy gets a bouncer, but it is a slower-ball bouncer, that Duminy eventually leaves alone
fuller to finish, guided down to third man for another gentle single
fuller ball, and Duminy comes down the wicket and leg side of the ball, slashes off an outside edge, once bounce to third man
pushed away into a space for one
Bravo has got away with one here, short and down the leg side, too far really as Duminy missed another attempted pull, but no wide called
more control here from Duminy, angling it down to third man for a single
full and a touch of width, de Villiers tries to smash it through point but ends up missing
pulled down the ground for a couple with such force that de Villiers ends up clutching his hamstring, let's hope it's just cramp
Duminy guides this away for a single, but it's time for South Africa to really push
worked into the leg side, in front of square for one

oh dear, Duminy has been badly hit here. Another short ball, he attempted a pull shot, but he doesn't play it well it crashes bang into the grill of the helmet. All the West Indies fielders and Taylor have come up to check out how he is. Which is good to see.
and so would Taylor, it seems, it's short but a touch wider of off, and Duminy sways inside it easily
well, how about that for a response! Shortish, but really wasn't short enough, Duminy got back and murdered a pull shot over midwicket for six
good thinking from Taylor, slower ball on off stump and defended carefully by Duminy
good start from Rampaul, de Villiers outfoxing himself, skipping leg side of the ball and watching it pass off stump
good from Rampaul, he has been mighty impressive today, lands this right in the blockhole, De Villiers swipes at nothing and it comes off the bat and pads for a single
this time Duminy swishes it down to deep square for just a single
de Villiers clears his front leg, attempts to swipe it over the leg side, but can't time it and it trickles to midwicket
Rampaul, take a bow! This is reward for an excellent over, Duminy skips far too far leg side of the ball, looking to carve it over cover, but misses and it crashes into the stumps
works his first ball off his hip to short third man for a single, to complete an excellent powerplay over by Rampaul
shortish on and around off stump, Miller guides it to third man for a single
not great bowling this, half-hearted short ball, Taylor is not fit enough, de Villiers swipes it firmly past midwicket for four
Taylor luck to get away with this, full toss on the legs, De Villiers clips it straight to the square leg fielder
better ball this, fuller, de Villiers gave himself room and tried to pierce the cover ring, but picked out Gayle at extra cover
much better from Taylor, full on off stump, de Villiers digs it out to mid on, takes him one short of a hundred
good finish to the over, back of a length, Miller forces it to extra cover for a swift single
big appeal is rewarded with a wide, it was short down the leg side, Miller swung hard at it but missed
fuller this time, outside off, Miller aims a big shot through the off side but misses, so Rampaul's good work continues
very good from Rampaul, back of a length, into the body, Miller dabs it to midwicket for a single
ooh, that must have been close! Full and swinging into de Villiers' pads, replays show it crashing into middle stump, so Daryll Harper has got another one wrong
oh excellent ball again, what brilliant bowling this is, full, straight, dug out back to the bowler, so de Villiers stays on 99
there it is! Excellent hundred from de Villiers, gets there by mistiming a slug down the ground
top batting from Miller, ruins an excellent over from Rampaul. It was a touch short but Miller backed himself to swing hard and deposit this over square leg for six
de Villiers looks very tired, and really shouldn't have got two there, smashed down the ground to long off from a shortish length

top catch! De Villiers departs! Full from Taylor, de Villiers had given himself room, trying to carve it over point but Sarwan, who isn't the tallest of fellows, leapt up and clasped the chance with two hands
Botha has such a peculiar look of concentration, with his buttoned-up shirt he gives off an amusing air, I can't explain it, anyway, he stand tall and drops this shortish ball into the off side
oops, short and arrowed down the leg side, too far for the umpire's liking
good slower ball this, outside off and under the flashing blade of Botha
fuller this time and driven confidently down to Bravo at mid off, who fumbles and allows an extra run
Botha down on one knee looking for a cheeky dink over short fine leg, misses and it thuds off his pad for a single
good ball from Bravo first up, full and straight and dug out down the ground for one
very straight bat from Miller, Boycott would love it, full face, down the ground, single
gone! Well, very simple this. Good ball from Bravo, honing on to leg stump, Botha aims an enormous swipe, misses, and leg stump is cartwheeling
McLaren off the mark in very comfortable fashion, watching this carefully and guiding it down to third man
very good from Bravo, full and straight, not much Miller can do but jab it back down the wicket, so straight in fact, that it crashes into the stumps at the non-strikers end
good ball once more to finish, Miller can't get any leverage and it's slugged away to mid on
Taylor lands it full and just outside off, Miller gives himself plenty of room, too much in the end and has to stretch to reach for it and squeeze it down to deep point
very well fielded from Sarwan at point, it was floated up wide of off stump, McLaren jabbed out a good cut shot, but Sarwan dived to prevent even one

oh, that is a cracker! Gayle has taken a fabulous catch! It was short, McLaren completely miss-timed a pull shot, it went behind square, Gayle dived, one-handed, behind him to his left to take a great catch
Steyn caresses his first ball into the covers for a single
full and outside off, Miller down the wicket giving himself room, slashes hard and it flies high down to third man but lands just short
good last over from Taylor, this ball is full and swung down to long on, where the throw comes in quickly to keep it to one
good running from Miller, he didn't time his bunt down the ground well at all, but it meant that it trickled away so he took two
very good from Bravo, mixing up his pace nicely, and Miller slashes and misses
full ball again, outside off, Miller tries to give himself room but only squeezes it to point
well, if Steyn connected here the ball would still be on it's way up, enormous swish outside off, but he doesn't hit the ball
fuller this time and Steyn shoves it down the ground for a single

great finish from Miller, poor Bravo didn't deserve that! It was full, Miller drove it firmly in the air and wide of long off, Nikita Miller ran round threw his hands at it but couldn't hold on and the innings finishes with a boundary

inn2.comm: Steyn starts with a beauty! Full, fast and swinging away. Fletcher has a look and leaves alone
testing lines once again from Steyn, and Fletcher is not quite fully behind the ball as he comes half-forward in defence
Steyn keeps it tight, and Fletcher tightens up too, getting solidly behind this one to defend to the off side
and again - Steyn is keeping the new ball nice and full and looking for swing. Fletcher defends square on the off side
Fletcher gets off the mark as Steyn fires one in just a little too straight and is clipped to midwicket
Steyn comes over the wicket and pushes one across Gayle. Not much swing on that one, it was back of a length, and Gayle lifted the bat over it to let the ball go by
there is some swing! Tsotsobe slants one full at Fletcher's legs, the ball swings in to the right-hander to strike him on the pad, but will outside off stump
more swing this time, as Fletcher comes forward to drive and the ball comes off the inner half of the bat and rolls back towards the bowler
pushes one across him this time, but Fletcher gets well forward to cover the movement and defends
driven this time, he wasn't quite to the pitch but got enough on it to pick up two, bisecting point and cover
a bit of a wild slash this time from Fletcher. The ball was pitched back of a length outside off and he didn't really move his feet, just through his hands at it and was lucky not to edge that
beaten! a beauty from Tsotsobe that went on with the arm instead of swinging in. Fletcher pressed forward in defence but couldn't get anything on it
Gayle beaten as well outside off stump! He was playing for swing as Steyn steamed in from over the wicket, but the ball just went straight on to beat the bat
this one does wobble in to the left-hander a touch, and Gayle defends to the off side on the front foot
stinger on the fingers! Good bouncer from Steyn, getting up throat high. Gayle tried to stand up tall and get on top of it, but the ball spat up to strike the splice and the glove.
too straight with a touch of swing on it, and Gayle clips behind square on the leg side

edged, and gone! Test match bowling from Steyn, and it's too good for Fletcher. The ball was fast, pitched up on off stump and swinging away. Fletcher came forward but couldn't cover the movement and the ball absolutely flew off the outside edge to Kallis at second slip. He took a good, sharp catch right infront of his face, and that's another failure with the bat for Fletcher
on a length, Bravo steps back in his crease and defends back down the pitch
Tsotsobe slants one in to Gayle's pads and is nudged behind square for one
jagging away from Bravo from over the wicket, but he covers it well and opens the face just a touch to pick up one to third man
good bowling, on a length and pitching on or around off stump. Gayle stands at the crease and drops the ball defensively to off
too straight, straying onto Gayle's legs once again and he's clipped down to fine leg, where the fielder slides to cut the ball off. Two runs taken

Tsotsobe slips in a bouncer, but he doesn't have the pace to trouble Gayle, who sways easily out of the way. It was also really dug in very short and ballooned about a metre over his head, and so that's a wide

crunch! Gayle's had a bit of a look and it was only a matter of time before the big shot arrived. He didn't get all of this one as he lofted a fuller ball over wide long, but it still bounced just once before crossing the boundary
there is still some life in this pitch though. This one jumped up off a length and Gayle, who's already been struck on the fingers by Steyn, takes one hand off the bat as he defends
too wide of off to have Bravo interested this early in his innings, left alone
and again, outside off and swinging away, Bravo shoulders arms
shot! That was all class from Bravo, as he drove on the up through the covers with a flashing bat and a high left elbow. He picked the gap to perfection and the ball raced away
Steyn over-corrects, sending the ball in at the pads and Bravo just about flicks to leg to pick up one
awkward ball! On a length, pitching middle and off, Gayle defends but he didn't look at all comfortable keeping that one out

dropped! Young Miller it was. The ball was a bit short, Gayle was immediately on the pull but hit the ball in the air out to deep square leg. Miller was placed perfectly to take it, but as he tumbled forward the ball just slipped out. Big drop, that
full, slanting in, and Gayle pushes to mid on
punched on the back foot into the covers. Really well-timed, but straight to the fielder - Miller again
slower ball from Tsotsobe, very full, and it was met with a flashing drive through mid off! Real power behind the shot there as he smashed it in the air past a leaping Hashim Amla
Gayle backs away as Tsotsobe gathers, the bowler follows him but is tapped down to long on for one
Bravo joins in! Slashed inside-out over the covers. Real aggressive intent and he went through with the shot. The ball went really high and bounced once or twice on its way over the rope

and again! Was that another cutter from Tsotsobe? Bravo was forward and driving again, but he seemed too early into the shot. He took the bottom hand off but still got enough on it to beat the infield and collect another four!
bunted down the ground. Not timed, and Smith runs back from mid off to keep them to two
full and on the toes, Gayle clips firmly to short midwicket

smashed! On the legs once again and Gayle swung across the line to send the ball speeding to the long on boundary. He went right through a diving Morne Morkel at mid on, it was hit so hard the fielder just couldn't get down to it in time
Gayle is in an aggressive mood here, backing away to flat-bat the ball down the ground. Didn't get all of it, and Morkel makes a better effort this time to keep them to one
too straight, Bravo gets forward and across to send the ball down to fine leg
crunched off the back foot! The cover fielder did well to cut that one off, as it would definitely been four had it got past him
interesting start, pitching just outside leg and wrapping Gayle above the pad.

dropped again! It was Amla this time, running back from midwicket to try and take a miscued mow to the leg side over his shoulder. The ball went really high, swirling in the breeze. Tough chance that, he just misjudged it as he ran back and couldn't get to it in the end - though he had a lot of time to do so
nudged backward of square on the leg side

McLaren strikes! He could have had Gayle, but he's dismissed Bravo in the end. The ball was pitched just short of a length, outside off and Bravo aimed a very optimistic swish to the off side. He was neither forward nor back, just flung the bat at it, and de Villiers snaffled the regulation chance behind the stumps
starts with a leave as McLaren sends one down wide of off
and again, a good few inches outside off and it's left alone despite a touch of seam movement in to the right-hander
back of a length, pitching middle and slanting away. Gayle just drops it down into the covers but can't place it to find the run
and again, Morkel is hitting a good length to get something from his extra height and Gayle can't get this one away either
good, tight bowling, pushed softly into the covers again
well, Gayle's had enough of these dot balls! He backs away and tries to carve Morkel through midwicket, but picks out the fielder so no run
Morkel re-asserts himself with a sharp bouncer. Gayle ducks underneath it in a hurry. That was pretty quick, up above 90mph
Gayle clears the left leg and tries to go through the covers this time, but again the shot finds the fielder and that's a maiden to start from Morkel
full and slanting in, Sarwan comes nicely forward in one fluid motion to drive but his shot is stopped in the covers
straighter this time, he looks for the drop-and-run to the leg side but midwicket is in too quickly
nice shot to get off the mark, on-drive to Smith at mid on
full and straight from McLaren, he's not given Gayle width to work with on either side of the wicket so far, and the batsman is right behind it to defend
and again, dead straight and aimed at the stumps. Too risky to try and get that away at this stage, and Gayle defends... but is the big shot coming?

well, he doesn't need to play the big shot to get the boundary. It looked as though McLaren tried to bowl the offcutter there, but pushed it down the leg side. Gayle moved across to send the ball past the short fine leg fielder for four
Morkel over-steps, and that'll be a free hit
no harm done, Sarwan isn't in good enough touch to take full toll, though he backed away and tried to power it down the ground. Got hardly anything on it, just tapped back to the bowler
Morkel fires one at the hips, it strikes Sarwan on the body and they pick up a leg-bye to short fine leg
just helped away by Gayle, so easy. Morkel sprayed one down the leg side with fine leg up and Gayle knew exactly where he was hitting that one. Didn't try to over-hit it at all, just placed it
Morkel corrects his line and Gayle taps patiently to mid off
they might have to re-think this field - Gayle backs away to leg, Morkel follows him but Gayle just swipes to leg, again short fine is beaten, four more

wow, now that must be de-moralising for a bowler. It was too full - a half-volley really - and Gayle absolutely hammered that straight down the ground, all along the turf. That screamed to the boundary!
good shot for no runs, as McLaren slips one wide and Sarwan cuts - but straight to backward point
dropped down close, just behind square on the off side. They think about a run, but Sarwan is quickly sent back
again he lets ball hit bat to try and find a sneaky single, but backward point swoops in to convince them otherwise
much fuller this time, Sarwan unfurls the leg glance but hits it straight to square leg. He's really picking the fielders here
there's the single, eventually! On a length outside off, Sarwan guides down to third man

well, Gayle didn't know where that one was going! He back away and hoicked wildly to leg, the ball came off the top edge and went in the opposite direction over point. He must have got a fair bit on that though, it only bounced once before it crossed the boundary!
drop and run behind square on the off side from Sarwan, Gayle makes it in safely to take the strike

one shot too many from Gayle, and he's easily caught off another spiralling top edge. The pressure was mounting on him with Sarwan unable to rotate the strike effectively and he went for another massive swipe to leg. He sent the ball up really high, but Botha was right underneath it at midwicket to hold onto the chance. Big, big wicket there
half an appeal from Morkel as Sarwan shuffles to the off side and is struck on the pad. Slipping down leg though
Morkel hits a length and Sarwan gets behind the ball to defend with the straightest of bats
dot ball once again as Sarwan defends to the on side
Morkel keeps it tight to finish the over, aiming at off stump, and Sarwan defends
slanted across Deonarine from over the wicket, the left-hander leaves alone
fuller this time, and Deonarine comes forward to defend into the covers
hits a length, not much you can do with that when you've just arrived at the crease, and Deonarine defends once again
a touch of width given, Deonarine looks to tuck the ball square but point is quickly around to cut it off
full and straight, and tapped defensively back to the bowler
slipping onto the pads, Deonarine gets across and flicks to leg to get off the mark
Morkel bangs one at Deonarine, who skips back and confidently defends back to the bowler
that'll do nicely for Deonarine, Morkel angling it in from round the wicket, Deonarine helps it on it's way for a four to fine leg
Morkel over the wicket and this is a good ball, pitching off and climbing, which happens when you bowl from 19ft, Deonarine leaves with a flourish
another ball outside off stump that Deonarine, steps forward confidently and leaves with real conviction, no doubt about that leave!
ooh, close, Deonarine pushes it mid off, and likes the look of his shot so much that he stands completely still, when, eventually he runs the throw would have beaten him had it hit the stumps
Sarwan is batting for the draw and looks very solid doing it, playing it firmly and confidently to point
this is my first look at Deonarine, and like the look of him, very confident, very stylish, punches this shortish ball to point
back of a length, hint of extra bounce but it's outside off stump, allowing Deonarine another of his exaggerated leaves
shorter this time, Deonarine ducks underneath it
a more experienced player might have been able to nurdle one from this, but Deonarine watched a very full ball on to the bat, defending it crisply back to the bowler
touch of width on this, should have worked a single, but Deonarine tries to flash a cut, can't time it and it trickles to point
well, West Indies are a touch stuck here, both the players are not power-hitters but are also unable to rotate the strike, here Deonarine defends to point
starts bang on a length and line, Sarwan stretches and dead-bats it
more intent here from Sarwan, and the line helped him, angling down leg and swept away for one
there we go, more of that needed to make a game out of this, Deonarine drops it on to the off side and Sarwan calls him through for a rapid single
Sarwan can't get it away, this is outside off and cut to point
back of a length here and worked to mid on, no run again
finally Sarwan gets a single, pushing the ball to mid on, Deonarine is ball-watching and him and Sarwan are almost joined at the bowlers end before Deonarine runs through
Sarwan can't seem to find any angles to work the ball around, instead this is played with the fullest face back to Kallis
touch shorter, Sarwan up on his toes and dropping this to Duminy at point, Deonarine scampers through for one
for all his style Deonarine seems unable to pick the gaps, this was short with a touch of width and he punched it straight to cover
once again worked confidently and crisply, and it should be said, a touch pointlessly, straight to cover
good short ball from Kallis here, dug in with intent and zipping over Deonarine's shoulder
another very tight over is completed, short ball around middle, Deonarine tried to whip it through midwicket, but can't time it at all and it goes back to the bowler
very nicely played by Sarwan, picked a gap backwards of square and timed a sweep shot superbly for a much-needed boundary
follows up the boundary with a firm-handed block to short-midwicket
touch shorter from Botha, Sarwan this times latches on to a cut shot, placing it nicely for a couple behind point
good here from Sarwan, working the ball from middle into a gap at midwicket for a single
Deonarine on the act now, sweeping with a flurry of wrists, one-bounce to deep midwicket
nicely played, this is much more like it, waited on the ball, turned his wrists over it and sent the ball into a gap behind square on the leg side
full ball from McLaren, angled in to Sarwan's pads, nurdled, actually nurdled into the midwicket region for a single
ooh, very close this time, Deonarine edged a flashy defensive stroke, and it flew between the keeper and Botha at wide slip, I dare say had the bowler been the man at slip this would have been out
oops, edge again from Deonarine, flashing outside off stump, this time wide of slip for a single
drifts on to the pads and Sarwan clips it away for a couple
defended solidly, too firmly really, into the off side, no run available there
back of a length, Sarwan hops back and blocks it into the cover region
arrowed down the legside from Botha, who has not quite got his line right yet today, Sarwan attempts another sweep and ends up gloving it down to fine leg for a couple
better line this time and worked away for a single in the off side
pressure just beginning to build on Deonarine, unable to work this off-stump ball away
beaten this time! Real flash outside off stump, a shot of pressure, and he misses
still Deonarine can't get it away, tries to force it down the ground but can't time it and Botha runs round to field
good quicker ball, arrowed past the shot and another dot ball
touch short and wide, Sarwan tries to cut, it's a touch too close for the shot so can't time it well but collects a single to point
back of a length, Deonarine unable to get it away again, forcing it back to the bowler
short ball, really short ball, too short in fact because it's called a wide
Deonarine really needed that, he's going to have a wild hack at one soon, this time he manages to whip it to midwicket for a single
back of a length again, Sarwan mistimes his cut into the off side and collects a single
oh dear, poor Deonarine, he's struggling, a wristy and stylish play-and-miss outside off stump

well something had to give, and Deonarine has nailed this! Took a few steps down the track, gave himself a touch of room and drove classically down the ground, timing it well enough to bring up the innings' first six
ooh, Sarwan chips a fullish off-stump ball one bounce to short midwicket
touch of room here, allows Sarwan to cut firmly to point for a single
Deonarine back into his shell here, defending carefully to cover
Botha gets his angle wrong here, shoving it down leg, Deonarine sweeps and helps it on it's way to fine leg for one
Sarwan again unable to work the strike here, pushing firmly back to the bowler
better shot this, picking the gap wider of the bowler to push the ball to long off for a strike-stealing single
starts well enough outside off stump, Sarwan lets it go
full and straight, worked straight to the mid on fielder
good ball, yorker length and straight, carefully pushed to midwicket
Tsotsobe lands this down the leg side, and clipped away to deep square for a single
Sarwan pushes this down to a gap at midwicket for one
oops, suicidal call from Deonarine, he dropped a full ball to Miller to mid off and sprinted through for a single, if Miller's under-arm flick had hit, Deonarine would have been well short
well bowled, hint of turn from a fullish length, Deonarine leans forward and defends
Deonarine edging down the track, looking to manufacture something, but Botha is a wily old fellow and slipped it in quicker
this time he collects one, working it into the cover region for a single
arrowed down the leg side, past the sweep for a wide
nicely played, this is worked into the leg side for one
not a great shot this, regulation ball on a length and line patted back to the bowler
better shot this time, closing the face at the last moment to send it down to long on
good ball from Tsotsobe, full and straight and jabbed out to midwicket
touch more width on this, allows a flashing cut, with a hint of outside edge, down to third man for a single
fullish ball outside off, flashing drive to deep point, the batsmen scamper through for a second
nicely played, worked down the ground casually for a single
angled into Deonarine's legs, whipped away for single to deep square
pushed across Sarwan, who dabs a drive away to point
too short from Botha, Deonarine lands a well-timed pull shot, which rockets one-bounce to deep midwicket
nicely played, just a fraction of width outside off, Sarwan gets back in a flash and cuts behind square for a couple
similar shot, it was a touch shorter so Sarwan cut in front of point for a couple more
Botha loses his line, angling down leg side, Sarwan works it round the corner for one
Botha strikes, that's the end for Deonarine. Gets down on one-knee to sweep, hint of extra bounce caught the gloves and it looped to Kallis at short fine leg. He does not drop dollies like that.
starts tidily enough, getting back and driving to long off for one
Tsotsobe continues, full and straight and driven to mid off
typical keeper's shot this, nudged into the leg side, then impish running collects a single
Sarwan defends this very correctly back to the bowler
Tsotsobe loses his line a touch, angling it to Sarwan's pads, he misses the nudge so it thuds away for a legbye
shot of a man out of form, fullish ball angling across him, played on the walk and missed
angled across again, though starting too wide to interest Ramdin, who opts to leave it well alone
Sarwan pushes this down to long on for a single
touch leg-sided from Botha, Ramdin dinks it round the corner for a single
similar ball but Sarwan gets too much on it and it goes to short fine leg
milked down the ground this time from Sarwan to long on
well, Ramdin will take it, but he didn't know much about it, flashing drive outside off, gets the edge and passes de Villiers in a flash to head down for four
final ball is defended into the off side quietly
oh no! That could be it. Morkel back for a new spell, bangs it in outside off, Sarwan attempting a nothing-shot really, open-faced nurdle with planted feet, gets an inside edge on to his off stump
Pollard finally has time to build an innings, but he doesn't have many partners left, Pollard defends into the off side
back of a length, rising but Pollard is a tall enough man, and he defends easily enough
much shorter this time, good line too, Pollard stands tall and defends
good ball this, angling into the arm-pit region, Pollard is again up on his toes and fending it into the leg side
good stuff from Morkel, it's always exciting when he bowls like this, short, sharp, straight, really pursing the batsman, who fends it past the keeper for a couple
Pollard tickles this round the corner for a single
Ramdin watches it carefully and pushes into the off side
was that a doosra!? Very possibly, too good from Ramdin as well, zipping past his outside edge
too short, allows Ramdin to watch the spin into him and tickle it into the leg side
arrow straight from Botha, Pollard can only defend
another ball on a length and line, Pollard is doing his best Boycott impression and defends
full, swinging in and straight from Steyn, Ramdin manages to get something on it and keep it out, just
touch shorter, Ramdin cuts past point for a single
good quick ball from Steyn, good line too, Pollard defends
Steyn attacking the stumps, he always does, ends up being a low full toss that Pollard digs out to wide long of for a couple
shorter ball, Pollard swings at it but can't connect, Pollard grunts, the ball trickles into the leg side, Steyn races round to field and keep his man on strike
fuller this time, Pollard half-clips-half-edges this in the air past midwicket, finding a gap and collecting three
you don't want to see Pollard playing shots like this, a delicate faint work to third man is attempted, and missed
pushed back to the bowler from a fuller length
once again, pushed gently back to the bowler
this time Pollard aims leg side, but his nudge finds the fielder
has another go at the dink to third man, connects and is rewarded with a single, he should stick to boshing it down the ground
Ramdin is a better nudger of the ball, and does it well enough here to find a gap and get one
full, straight, and defended into the covers
a touch shorter and wider, the sort of delivery that has runs written on it, but Ramdin's cut picks out the fielder
short and sharp bouncer, really rapid that, Ramdin ducks under it
shorter and cut this time behind point for a single
oops, shoved miles down the leg side here, Pollard has nothing to do with it
banged in outside off stump, Pollard rises with it and guides it to deep point for a couple
boom! Steyn pitches it up, Pollard dumps it into the stands back over the bowler's head. Lovely clean strike through the line
Morkel pitches up outside off, too good for Ramdin, who plays his defensive shot when the ball was in the keeper's gloves
short enough this time for Ramdin to jump up and guide it to deep point for a single
good ball this, pitched up but from Morkel's height, there is plenty of bounce, defended awkwardly
Morkel gets this wrong, arrowing it down the leg side for a wide
better ball from Morkel, finding a line and length and when he does that he's so difficult to play, crashes into Pollard's thigh
not sure what happened here, arrowed down the leg side, but swings out when it passes the stumps, de Villiers misses it and runs given, looked wide to me
Morkel is a flurry of arms and legs, first bowling then fielding the ball and throwing down the stumps, all in one movement, he ends up on the floor in a heap, looking puzzled
who starts well enough on a line and length and Pollard defends
good ball this, pitched up and angling in, Pollard defends from the crease in a hurry
very good from McLaren, and quite impressive defence from Pollard too, full straight, Pollard looks a picture of Atherton in his pomp, defending with all his might
shoved in shorter, Pollard tries to hook and doesn't get much of it, it loops down to fine leg, who can't quite reach it diving forward
back of a length here, defended carefully into the off side
fuller and a lovely drive from Ramdin, except he missed the ball
full and straight, Pollard clips it firmly to mid on
back of a length this time and Pollard has seen enough, swiping it from outside off back down the ground for four, all power there
Pollard on the attack again, swishing at it, but it skews off the inside edge down the Amla on the midwicket boundary
good save at point from Duminy, Ramdin crashed a cut shot, would have been a certain boundary but Duminy intercepted
touch shorter there, Pollard on the back foot is not quite so fearsome, and he works it round the corner for a single
oh nasty stuff from Morkel, banging it in just short of a length, finding extra bounce and it crashes into Ramdin's gloves
don't bowl there! Full toss on leg stump, Pollard slams it, real thunder-clap as ball meets bat and it's rocketed for four past square leg
fuller and wider this time, inviting Pollard to nail it past point for another boundary
full again from McLaren, why? Pollard clips it past midwicket for a couple more
well, not all brute from Pollard, this is smart too, full once more from McLaren, Pollard angles it wide of the keeper down the third man region for another boundary
good ball from McLaren, dug in with real intent, Pollard less frightening there, fends it away for a single
full toss for Ramdin, he really should have found the boundary there, instead he pushed it to cover
very clever from Steyn, slower ball on a length outside off, Pollard can't do much other than guide it to point and scamper one
short, very short, Ramdin skips leg side of the ball and looks for the upper-cut, misses it, but no wide given
very good from Steyn, really thought this through, another slower ball, Ramdin giving himself room looking to carve it over point, but is too early on it and ends up inside-edging on to his stumps
plays his first ball very carefully back to the bowler
Steyn finally gets one wrong this over, landing it too fair outside off and it's a wide
good bowling, fullish and swinging away, Sammy swishes and misses outside off
very good over from Steyn, just two runs off it, this is back of a length, Sammy works it to cover
good shot from Pollard, hanging on the back foot waiting for a shot ball, gets it and slams it behind square on the leg side for four

that might well be it. Pollard falls. Fullish, Pollard tried to swing it over long on, but it got the toe end, went high and swirling down to McLaren, who made no mistake and took the catch on the boundary's edge
uller length delivery on middle, Sammy drives it to long on
Miller didn't know much about this, full, quick and zipping past his outside edge
Miller gets forward and pushes this to cover in a hurry
full once again, Miller's feet are rooted, this comes off a tentative inside edge and goes down to fine leg
nice shot here, Steyn looking for the yorker, it was clipped away to deep midwicket for a couple
on off stump this time, pushed into the cover region
down the leg side, attempted nurdle missed, big appeal from Steyn but not given
didn't play this very fell at all, that will hurt, short ball, Miller just stood there and let it hit him in the chest, he doesn't even rub where the ball hit, tough fellow clearly
shorter ball again, Miller tried to hack it away but missed, it was through him in a flash
short again, slower this time, and it's Miller who is too quick on this one
good length and line, Sammy defends into the off side
oh dear, back of a length pushed to point, single run, but if Duminy's throw had hit it would have been gone
this is tough for the lower order, not much they can do, Sammy tries to smack it over midwicket, can't time it, gets a top edge down to Kallis on the boundary
left alone outside off
slower ball, swish and a miss
driven uppishly down the ground for a couple
good ball from Botha, who is only one 'm' away from Botham, I may add, on a good length and line and defended
gone this time, in bizarre fashion, it pitched in line, Taylor left it, and ushered it on to his pad, and it's plumb
Rampaul, who bowled so well today, defends his first ball carefully
forward and defending once more
this time it's driven into the cover region for a single
good strike from Miller, down on one knee and smacking it over midwicket for a boundary, one final cheer for the lively crowd
banged in short, very short, Rampaul has to jump and throw his arms at it, but can't connect
ooh, would have been gone here had McLaren collected the throw from point as Rampaul pushed it and ran
Miller attempts to smash it to cow corner, but cannot time it at all and it trickles down the ground
gets some bat on it here, swishing it to point for a single
fuller and defended into the off side
nicely turned off his legs into the midwicket region for a single

that's it! All over! Comprehensive victory for South Africa. Rampaul tries to smack it down the ground, doesn't get much of it and Smith takes the catch. Gentle high-fives all round for the South African's. Gayle does not look overly amused, but shakes hands with all the opposition players.
